clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dietary Fructose on Gut Microbiota and on Hepatosteatosis in Healthy Men

brief_summary.textblock: The consumption of sugar-sweetened beverages (SSB) has increased steadily over the past decades, resulting in the dramatic increase of fructose intake as it is one of the main ingredients of artificial sweeteners. Recently, large epidemiological studies have documented the association between a high-fructose-diet and hepatic steatosis, and other metabolic disorders. So it is interesting for scientists to explore the underlying mechanism. This study aims to investigate the effect of dietary fructose and gut microbiota and the hepatosteatosis in healthy men. Serum and fecal metabolomics will be investigated.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single center, randomized, controlled study. 60 healthy men will be recruited according to the inclusion criteria. All subjects are randomly allocated to Group A and Group B, who orally takes 75g and 150g fructose daily respectively. Subjects in Group A will be instructed to drink fructose solution containing 75g fructose per day, and those in Group B will be instructed to drink fructose solution containing 150g fructose per day. The intervention will last four weeks. The anthropomentric data will be collect with questionnaire and serum and fecal samples collected at baseline and the end of the intervention. The effect and mutual interaction of dietary fructose and microbiota will be explored. The effect of dietary fructose on hepatosteatosis will be investigated as well.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 60 healthy men will be recruited according to the inclusion criteria. All the participates are randomly allocated to Group A and Group B. Subjects in Group A will be instructed to drink fructose solution containing 75g fructose per day and those in Group B will be instructed to drink 150g fructose per day.

primary_outcome.description: The change of microbiota in fecal samples from the baseline to the end of the intervention will be determined.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of intra-hepatic triglyceride content(IHTG)
primary_outcome.description: The IHTG will be measured using MRI-PDFF

secondary_outcome.description: Serum metabolomics will be determined using MS.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of serum proinflammatory factors
secondary_outcome.description: Serum proinflammatory factors, including TNFa, IL-6 will be measured.

arm_group.description: Subjects in Group A will drink 75g fructose solution daily for 4 weeks.
Subjects in Group A will drink 150g fructose solution daily for 4 weeks.

intervention.description: Subjects will drink a bottle of 350 ml solution containing 75g fructose per day for 4 weeks.
Subjects will drink a bottle of 700 ml solution containing 150g fructose per day for 4 weeks.
